intro: Raoulia apice-nigra, commonly known as the black-tipped raoulia, is a flowering plant native to New Caledonia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often dark green in color. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers with prominent yellow stamens. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Raoulia apice-nigra is typically found in moist, shaded environments within the undergrowth of tropical forests.
